Case reference: 2013000004.CaseDesc: John Wade left his parents’ home in Halifax, NS on June 17, 2012. He left on foot while distraught, leaving behind his identification, bank card and money. He has been known to reside on the streets and does have connections to Edmonton, AB. Mr. Wade has previously hitchhiked across Canada. He suffers with mental illness and is diagnosed with schizophrenia.

Teeth: Good, Upper front tooth is capped

Case reference: 2014006315.CaseDesc: Julia STROBACH was last seen in her residence on Braidwood Road in Courtenay, British Columbia on October 31st, 2013 in the early evening hours.  Unfortunately, after a lengthy and comprehensive investigation police have been unable to find any trace of Julia.  Police along with Julia’s friends and family are gravely concerned for Julia's wellbeing as she has been out of contact for a year now.  It is completely out of character for Julia to be out of contact with her friends and family for so long, especially with her 3 year old son.  Police are appealing to anyone with information about Julia's movements and activities in the days and weeks leading up to October 31st, 2013, to get in touch with investigators immediately.

Hair: Brown, Dyed, Long,  Often dyed red

Case reference: 2014005326.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1972, Edmonton Police Service members found a purse and identification belonging to Eunice Antoniuk on the walkway of the High Level Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta. A note addressed to her family was found within the purse. All police searches were negative and Eunice has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006001999.CaseDesc: On March 28, 1993, an unidentified man was discovered close to the CP railway tracks near Royal York road and Dundas Street in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that he was of East Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Had natural teeth with no dental work
Jeans: Denim, Blue, second pair - was wearing two pairs of jeans
Jacket: Nylon, Dark Blue, winter jacket with a zipper and a hood

Case reference: 2013000145.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Ralph Simington. He was last seen in Calgary, Alberta on June 15, 2012.

Case reference: 2014004699.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2005, Veeravi Jeya Eskimuttu "VJ", was last seen leaving his place of employment in Saint John, NB. He is known to be transient and has lived in Toronto, Cornwall, Montreal and Halifax.

Case reference: 2014003314.CaseDesc: Dorothy Spence was last seen panhandling near a bridge in downtown Vancouver by a family member on or about August 17, 1995. Ms. Spence was of no fixed address and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Foul play has not been ruled out in Ms. Spence's disappearance.

Case reference: 2014001572.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1970, Arthur Stephens left his home in Gimli, Manitoba. He had planned to go fishing in the Whiteshell Provincial Park. Arthur told his wife that he would return on July 21, 1970. He further advised her that if he was going to stay any longer, he would call her to let her know. By July 22, 1970, Arthur had not returned home and his wife hadn't received a phone call. She reported him missing to police that day. On August 1, 1970, Arthur's vehicle was located near Falcon Beach.  Extensive ground, lake and air searches were done of the area. All efforts to locate him failed to uncover any further leads. Arthur Stephens whereabouts remain unknown.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Circular tattoo (exact design/pattern unknown)

Case reference: 2018027643.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2008, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario, near the Shoreview Place Beach in Stoney Creek, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of Sub-Saharan African ancestry.

Case reference: 2020006482.CaseDesc: On January 11, 1990, Emabit Yafru travelled from Ethiopia to Toronto, Ontario. On January 25, 1990, her husband came to Toronto and could not locate her. During the time of her disappearance, Emabit was five months pregnant.

Case reference: 2014003434.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 18, 1986, Monique Brosseau was seen for the last time at her home in Duhamel-Ouest, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002340.CaseDesc:
Margaret Schochenmaier was last seen on November 30, 1985, sometime after 3:00pm.  On that day Margaret was in the process of moving from her son's residence; but she never finished the move.
Margaret has previously gone missing in the past, usually for a few days to one month.

Scar: Forehead, Small scar on the left side

Case reference: 2012001299.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1991, a male was found on the shoreline of Sandy Beach in Michipicoten Harbour, Lake Superior, near Wawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead from a few weeks to a few months.

Scar: Upper Back, 1.3 cm midline circular scar
Right Abdomen, 6 cm scar, possible hernia repair
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Ankle, Plate with 5 screws, healed/old

Case reference: 2006019699.CaseDesc:
Pierre Couture was last seen in Cowansville, Quebec. He may have been hiding from
authorities and has not been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2014005435.CaseDesc: Although it is unconfirmed, acquaintances of Douglas Scott Renz indicate that he may have left the Chilliwack area in early 2009.  Mr. Renz last had contact with friends in the Chilliwack area in February of 2010, they reported him missing that April.

Case reference: 2014001795.CaseDesc: John Boone has been missing since December 24, 1998, in Saint John, NB. Mr. Boone suffers from depression and reportedly was not taking his medication. Mr. Boone's family is from the St Andrews, NB area.

Case reference: 2006015699.CaseDesc: Troy Edgell was last seen on June 4, 2000, in Cornwall, Ontario, driving a maroon 1987, Lincoln. On June 5, 2000, the Lincoln was located, burned out in the Lanark Highlands, northwest of Perth, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000046.CaseDesc: On June 27, 2004, Richard McGuire was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle was found in a garage located in the municipality of St-Elzear in the La Nouvelle-Beauce Regional County in Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004643.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2002, Carol Tuks was last seen while exiting a Greyhound bus in Red Deer, Alberta.

Pierce: Ears, single piercing in each ear

Case reference: 2014005032.CaseDesc: Edward Dufresne was last seen on 12 April 1993 at his home in Ste-Félicité, Quebec. He lived alone in a small house on Route 132. Edward regularly walked along the roads, picked mussels by the water, and also went into the forest to hunt for small game.

Chain: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With keys tied to a string

Case reference: 2000000830.CaseDesc: Charlene was last seen hitch-hiking at the intersection of Hwy 3 and the Rae Access Road.

Case reference: 2012020661.CaseDesc: Darlene Anderson was last seen leaving the Hantleman Building at the Royal University Hospital in Saskatoon on November 6, 2006 at 8:00 pm.

Case reference: 2014002904.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1980, Marcel Lapointe was last seen at his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000069.CaseDesc: Richard Riquier was last seen in Montreal on April 17, 1973. He might be in a religious cult in the United States or in India.

Case reference: 2020007310.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1970, at approximately 3:00pm, John Brimskill was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001217.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2011, the body of an adult male believed to be approximately 55 years old, was found near the "La Maison du Père" homeless shelter located in the Ville-Marie district in Montreal, Quebec. This person is unknown to this organization. The man had bypass surgery for arthosclerotic heart disease in the past.

Shoes: Grey, Blue, Sportek brand running shoes; size 9

Case reference: 2012020001.CaseDesc: Todd Beeching has been missing since mid 2005 although it wasn't reported until May 27, 2011.  He is believed to have been last seen in the Midway, BC area.

Case reference: 1984142670.CaseDesc: On January 20, 1983, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Tania Murrell was seen for the last time as she left school to return home.

Case reference: 2016065648.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1968, skeletal remains were located at the base of a 50 foot cliff on the bank of the lower Niagara River, Niagara Falls. A pair of boots was located with the remains.

Case reference: 2012020021.CaseDesc: Madison Scott went missing in 2011. She was at a party in the early morning hours of May 28th at Hogsback Lake, and was to camp there overnight. In the morning her friends found her tent and her pickup truck, but Maddy was nowhere to be found. Her purse was found in the truck but her phone and keys were missing. When Maddy didn't return home her parents became worried and reported her missing.

Case reference: 2011002399.CaseDesc: Cynthia Sunga was last seen at her family home on Donald street, on or about August 25, 2005.  She was reported missing to the Ottawa Police on November 11, 2005, by a family member.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Molar number 16 Upper missing, removed in 2000. The records of the bordering teeth available.
Tattoo: Lower Back, Tribal heart - Chinese characters for strong

Case reference: 2013000054.CaseDesc: On December 28, 2006, Carlisle Callum-Drummond was seen for the last time in the Cotes-des-Neiges -Notre-Dame-de-Grace district of Montreal, Quebec. Carlisle left from his home and it is possible that he may be with his father, who is also missing.

Case reference: 2014000012.CaseDesc: On March 16, 1968, an unidentified, medium built, Caucasian male was found in the Fraser River, near Bristol Island, BC . The deceased had 3 well-healed finger amputations on his left hand, a 3 cm scar on his chin, no teeth in his upper jaw and some teeth remaining in his lower jaw. The time of death is estimated between September 1967 and March 1968.

Case reference: 2014003896.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, at approximately 3:30 p.m., Johanne Couture was seen for the last time when she left the Hôtel-Dieu Hospital in Lévis, Quebec. The following day, Johanne’s purse was found in the Chaudière Falls Park in Lévis.

Case reference: 2014002146.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1984, John Lake  was last seen leaving a hospital in Vancouver, British Columbia. He stated he was heading to Seattle.

Scar: Left Side Of Head, From ear to chin

Case reference: 2014004801.CaseDesc: Beant Singh Khosa was last seen in Punjab, India on April 15th, 2006.  He travelled to India to attend his father's funeral and never returned.  It is rumored he has returned to Canada, however, his family and friends have not heard from him.

Case reference: 2006022699.CaseDesc: Nick Hibbart was prospecting when he was last seen by police at his camp on Gravel River on June 8, 1988. Police returned to the area on July 25, 1988, and found that the camp was burned to the ground. There was no sign of Mr. Hibbart and investigations have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2015052895.CaseDesc: Ujjvalkumar Patel was last seen on June 15, 2015 at his workplace in Brampton, ON. Ujjvalkumar was attending college in Ontario. He told his landlord he was returning to India for a family emergency but never showed up.

Case reference: 2014002303.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1960, Herbert Lafferty was seen for the last time as he checked rabbit snares with his grandfather, just outside of Fort Resolution in the Northwest Territories. Herbert did not return from checking those snares, and some of his friends had reported that Herbert had indicated that he had made plans to rejoin his mother in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006027999.CaseDesc: On August 15, 1986 Clayton Duncan McFaul was last seen by a family member on the family farm near Havelock Ontario. Mr. McFaul was completing his usual daily farm chores. He was very punctual about meal times, so when he failed to arrive for his lunch his family were concerned. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. McFaul.  Several possible sightings were reported after August 15, 1986, but none led to Mr. McFaul's location.

Hair: Bald, White, Other, Bald with fringe

Case reference: 2006012899.CaseDesc: Delmar Henderson was last seen in the area of Burnt River (Kinmount), Ontario on June 2, 1983.

Case reference: 2022035325.CaseDesc: Scott Graham travelled to Europe on June 28, 2022. He had travelled by land to Spain from Amsterdam and was to make his way back to Amsterdam to depart for Canada by July 29th, 2022. On July 13th, 2022, he contacted family to tell them that his bag containing his daily medication and passport had been lost/stolen at a tour bus stop in Spain. Scott was last confirmed to have been in Madrid, Spain on July 15th, 2022, where he attended the Canadian Embassy and a hospital to get documents and medication. His family has not heard from his since and are very concerned. Scott did not return to Canada as scheduled.

Case reference: 2006006699.CaseDesc: Eric Larsfolk and John McCormick were last seen playing at the McCormick farm in Caledon. They have not been seen since.

Case reference: 2019040199.CaseDesc: In March 1966, the remains of a male believed to be between the ages of 50-60 were discovered by the CN Railway tracks in Chilliwack, British Columbia. The unidentified male had lost many of his teeth during life and had prominent eyebrows and a broken nose which was crooked to the right. It is believed he may have fallen or have been pushed from a moving train.

Teeth: Most of the teeth have been lost
Shoes: Black, Rubber soles, "Bilt-Rite Oil Proof", size 10, width E
Pants: Blue, With brown and white suspenders
Coat: Wool, Brown, Herringbone pattern, striped brown and light brown
Deformity: Nose, Nose crooked to the right due to an old injury

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2005002899.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2002, the skeletal remains of an adult female were discovered in a heavily wooded area just south of Beagle Club Road off Highway 45 in Alnwick-Haldimand Township, Northumberland County, north of the town of Cobourg. It is believed that death occurred a few months to years prior to discovery. Police are investigating this case as a suspicious death.

Teeth: Evidence of past dental work including metal and white fillings

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2012020161.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the Fraser River in Vancouver. He was warmly dressed in two layers of clothing and work boots.

Sweater: Green, Blue, Striped, red on the cuffs
Black, "Haines her way" brand, size small

Case reference: 2020040348.CaseDesc: Muriel Jones was seen for the last time in 1959 in Toronto, Ontario. Muriel had indicated that she was intending on traveling to the West.

Case reference: 2014003152.CaseDesc: Sylvain Baril was last seen on August 8, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014003946.CaseDesc: Jean Siegel went missing from her home on May 31, 1962. Ms. Siegel had left her home on three previous occasions but always returned on her own. Jean Siegel's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005577.CaseDesc: Ganiyu Adedeji Onabule was reported missing in Edmonton in June of 1975. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006020099.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1974, Louis Wesley was last seen in Chamberlain Narrows, Lac Seul. He was involved in a boating accident and is presumed to have drowned in the lake, 48 km north of Hudson. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2009004999.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance, Dawn Carisse was a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. She is generally very pleasant though suffers from short term memory loss due to cardiac arrest several years earlier.  Dawn Carisse always spoke of leaving the hospital and going to where she believed her family would be. Her family was in the Kirkland Lake area and then moved to Sudbury. She was aware of both, and her possible destinations were Kirkland Lake or Sudbury. She was last seen on Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Parted in centre, short bangs
Luggage: May have had a dark duffle bag in her possession.
Dress: Maroon, Pink, Long dress with faint white flowers, short sleeves and front buttons.

Case reference: 2021014442.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, Phillip Jordan was seen for the last time by witnesses as he entered the water’s edge at Prospect Point, Niagara Falls in New York state. During the time of his disappearance, Phillip was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Black and white anchor

Case reference: 2014001967.CaseDesc: Mary Agnes Thomas was last seen on September 10, 1971 in a bush camp on the Fraser River approximately 2.4 kilometers from Quesnel, BC. Mrs. Thomas was with friends and is described as having been heavily intoxicated at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014030834.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1967 at approximately 9:00 a.m. John Pawloski, his common-law wife and a young boy (9 years old) were fishing in the area of Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. John's fishing rod started to slip into the water and he ran to reach at it. He fell into the fast moving water. His wife attempted to rescue him, but she too slipped on the rocks and fell into the water. The young boy ran to get help and when he looked back he could no longer see the couple.  The body of John's wife was found down the river shortly after the incident. Searches for John's body were done by air, land and water but the body was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2011762660.CaseDesc: Brittany Stalman was last seen on Crawford Drive, Delta, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020074.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1988 Cathy Williams left her residence in St. Andrews, Manitoba to go to Winnipeg to fill out a job application.  She had made arrangements to meet a male acquaintance who was going to help her complete the application.  During the late afternoon and early evening, Cathy and her friend attended two bars and eventually ended up at a restaurant.  Cathy left her friend at the restaurant.  From the restaurant, Cathy attended the residence of another male acquaintance who invited her in for a visit.  She indicated she had to get her purse from her friends car and she was going to be back in half an hour.  This was the last time Cathy Williams was seen.  Cathy was reported missing by her mother on the morning of August 23, 1988.  Cathy has not been heard from again and her body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014005316.CaseDesc: On March 31, 2002, Jenifer Morse was seen for the last time when she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002517.CaseDesc: Hélène Laferrière was seen for the last time on October 5, 1976, in the Saint-Sacrement District in Quebec City, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004850.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2006, Mario Julien was seen for the last time when he left his home aboard a taxi. The taxi transported him just to the roundabout in the Québec Bridge, in Quebec City, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish. They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2014005033.CaseDesc: On April 28, 2000, at approximately 9:45 a.m., Kim Mezo was seen for the last time as she left the Branson Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2011000299.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2010, the skeletal remains of a Caucasian male were found in the forest near Chemin Lac Clair in West Nipissing, Ontario. He is believed to have been there from two weeks to six months.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length
Teeth: Some dental work and some untreated dental disease
Other: Signs of arthritis in his feet. Bandages on them suggesting that he may have experienced pain

Case reference: 2006000599.CaseDesc:
On May 12, 1988, this Caucasian male was a passenger on a motorcycle involved in a motor vehicle accident. His post-mortem height was recorded as being, approximately 5’7"-5’8" however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. 
He is described as well-nourished. He has rough, calloused hands with oil or grease under his fingernails.

Hair: Brown, Collar length hair, thin moustache
Teeth: Severe crowding of lower incisors and an amalgam restoration in each first molars with the exception of the upper left
Boots: Brown, Western boots, tan coloured leather with worn heels, "Modella" Brand, size 9 1/2-D
Socks: White sport socks with blue and green stripes
Chain: Gold, Chain, gold triangular loop charm with a "Playboy Bunny" in the center.
Underwear: Black bikini style underwear, size L
Shirt: Black t-shirt with a "Jack Daniels" logo, size XL
Jeans: Denim, Blue, "Great Western Garment Company" brand jeans, size 36" waist and 30" inseam
Mark: Dark mole on the side of his left knee.
Scar: Scar in his right groin area, possibly from a hernia repair.

Case reference: 2012020070.CaseDesc: Leslie Thomas was reported missing December 8, 2000.  He was last seen walking west on Hwy #201 of the Roseau River First Nation in the first week of November.  Mr. Thomas' whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2016066676.CaseDesc:
Between August 6th and August 13th, 1969, several body parts, believed to belong to the same male individual, were recovered from the water around the Ontario Hydro Forebay, Niagara Falls.
His eyes are brown with very prominent arcus senilis (ring-shaped grayish-white deposit near the peripheral edge of the cornea). His appendix and gall bladder are present. This individual was estimated to have been in the water for at least a few days to a week prior to recovery.

Hair: Grey, White, Facial hair a few days growth in length
Teeth: 1 post. tooth in upper jaw; few missing lower jaw. Teeth: dirty, carious & marked periodontitis. No evidence of dental work

Case reference: 2012020064.CaseDesc: On June 24, 2000, Irma Murdock was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. It is believed that Irma may have travelled to Vancouver, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2009005399.CaseDesc: Brian Henry was last seen in North Bay, Ontario on May 5, 1974, at approximately 3:00pm. On that day, his father drove him to Canadore College, so he could walk the nature trails.

Jacket: May have been wearing a green work jacket
May have been wearing a dark blue work jacket
Denim, Blue, "Coca Cola" logo on left pocket
Watch: Black, With a large black strap, glowed in the dark
Hat: Black, Cowboy or scout type hat

Case reference: 2020035556.CaseDesc: On the night of August 31, 2020, Cory Westcott was seen for the last time in Bonnington, located approximately 10 minutes outside of Nelson, British Columbia. Cory was reported missing to the Nelson Police Department on September 4, 2020.

Teeth: Gold crown on upper front left tooth
Backpack: Other, Multi-coloured side bag, Supreme brand
Tattoo: Neck, Unknown tattoo across front of neck

Case reference: 2013000079.CaseDesc: Gilles Chiasson has been missing from Montreal since April 18, 1995. Mr. Chiasson took a taxi after a night out in a bar and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2010003099.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2010, OPP received a report that support cheques for Shelley Anderson of Cobalt Ontario, were returned uncashed for the past 12 months. Police attempted to locate her but were unsuccessful. She was last seen in the Haileybury and Cobalt area some time during the summer of 2009. Ms. Anderson also has ties to the Timmins and Schumacher areas, as she lived there for most of her life.

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2012020049.CaseDesc: William Krowchuk was last seen leaving his residence in Saskatoon, SK, around 10:00 p.m. on July 9, 1998. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was located on July 14, 1998, in the downtown area of Saskatoon.

Deformity: Left Large Toe, No toe nail
Right Large Toe, No toe nail

Case reference: 2014003631.CaseDesc: Xiu Zi Lin was last seen on February 3, 1998 in Montreal. Ms. Lin came from China with no documentation or family. She was placed in a shelter. She left the center without giving a new address.

Case reference: 2014004348.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1998, Steven Mylan was last seen at his family residence in Mississauga Ontario.  It is believed that Steven might have been headed to New York, and or, Arizona State in the United States of America.

Jacket: Wool, Black, Waist length, Sheep lining

Case reference: 2009005199.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2009, the body of a Caucasian woman was found in a small one person tent in a wooded area, in Kenora, Ontario. The investigation revealed that the deceased had at one time undergone reconstruction of the jaw. The facial bones were cut surgically and then moved, and the upper and lower jaws were re-adjusted, resulting in changes in the facial structure. It is also probable that the deceased had braces in adulthood. Spots on her lower teeth suggest that she might have been a smoker. She was believed to be in the tent for a day or two and not more than a week before she was discovered. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified woman is of European ancestry.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Light brown almost dark blonde
Medication: a two pack of Back and Muscle pain relief pills
Underwear: Cotton, Grey, undershirt with built in sports bra and thin straps
Money: 75.00$ in Canadian bills and 2.84$ in Canadian coins
Foreign Object: Jaw, maxilla-facial surgery, wire sutures in jaw

Case reference: 2016057640.CaseDesc: In the early hours of October 10, 2016, Terence Alook was last seen when he left a party at his aunt's home in the community of Desmarais, Alberta. Mr. Alook had been visiting his friends and family in the north end of Desmarais.

Other: Chin, Two moles on the lower chin

Case reference: 2021052226.CaseDesc: On January 28, 2016, at approximately 1:45 p.m., Daniel Leslie was last seen at Terrapin Point, on the American side of Niagara Falls, in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was despondent.

Case reference: 2014002883.CaseDesc: George Myrick was last seen on March 16, 1987, when he went duck hunting, but he never returned to St. Shott’s, Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2017076047.CaseDesc: On July 1, 2017, an unidentified male body was located on the west bank of the North Saskatchewan River and approximately 300m south of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020005.CaseDesc: David Cox was last seen on April 8, 2011 in the Cranbrook, BC area.  He was known to be living a high risk lifestyle. His disappearance is considered suspicious in nature and foul play has not been ruled out.

Case reference: 2019052572.CaseDesc: On January 1, 1995, Bojan Stamenkovic was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Bojan was a mechanical engineer and a University of Toronto professor after he came to Canada from Serbia. At the time of his disappearance, he told his family that he would not be able to contact them for awhile due to unknown circumstances. Bojan has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006020899.CaseDesc: Pooran Shivcharan, age 36, was last seen in an aircraft heading west bound in the direction of Geraldton, Ontario on November 13, 1981. Although he was originally headed toward Thunder Bay, he may have altered his course towards Geraldton or Raith.  Search efforts were unable to locate Mr. Shivcharan or his aircraft.

Case reference: 2022015231.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2022, Kyle Brocklebank was seen for the last time walking in the area of Thirty Road, in the town of Smithville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005111.CaseDesc: Chad Eirikson was reported missing by his mother. He left Vancouver, Canada to tour Central America in December, 1999.  In January, 2000, he called home requesting money a few times and received wire transfers from his mother to continue his trip. He has not been heard from since January 9, 2000.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"

Case reference: 2014003406.CaseDesc: Anthony Janvier was last seen at the courthouse in Cold Lake, Alberta on April 8, 1998. He was reported missing by his mother on February 7, 2002. Anthony lived a transient lifestyle which accounts for the 4 year delay in reporting him missing.

Case reference: 2014001900.CaseDesc: Andre Gauthier was last seen at approximately 10:15 pm the evening of September 23, 1984 near Simms Corner on the west side of Saint John, NB.

Other: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Lighter with "Andre" engraved on the front, "July 10, 1984, Irene + Paul" on the back

Case reference: 2014003890.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1973, Guy Carignan was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia with a female friend. His family reported him missing on May 28, 1980. Investigations were conducted in Edmonton, Alberta and Vancouver, British Columbia. Law enforcement were unable to locate Guy or his female friend.

Case reference: 2014004453.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2004, Samuel Samuelson was seen for the last time while driving a snowmobile by the lake on Bizard Island toward Deux Montagnes in Montreal, Quebec. The ice collapsed and Samuel and his snowmobile fell into the water.

Jewelry: Gold, Chain with razor blade pendant
Gold, Bracelet worn on right wrist

Case reference: 2008022299.CaseDesc: On Friday August 15, 2008, a male was recovered from the waters of the Detroit River, floating along the western shore of Fighting Island. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 146 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to a couple of weeks.

Hair: Black, Curly, Short, Signs of greying and a beard
Teeth: Visible Missing, He had lost all of his teeth in life, but it is likely that he wore dentures.
Pants: Grey, Sweatpants, Label back seam Donald Duck face and "Iceberg Jeans" label back pocket with Mickey Mouse face.
Shirt: Blue, Longsleeve, "Massini" brand long sleeved checkered shirt, size large

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2014005899.CaseDesc: Karen Gilbert left her home in Quebec City on October 7, 2012, at some point during the night. She was subsequently dropped off by taxi in the vicinity of the Montmorency Falls. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005289.CaseDesc: On October 13, 1989, Clara Charles was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. On that day, Clara and her husband were moving and had a friend come over to help them. Clara told her husband that she and her friend were going to bring their furniture to their new address in Brampton, Ontario, and were to return later that evening.

Case reference: 2014027689.CaseDesc: Sindy Ruperthouse's family has had no news of her since April 2014 and on September 2, 2014, they reported her missing to the Sûreté du Québec of Amos. Mrs. Ruperthouse was last seen in Val d'Or on April 22, 2014 during a consultation at the Local Community Service Centre (CLSC).

Case reference: 2012020066.CaseDesc: On October 22, 1988, in the early evening Betsy Owens was playing volleyball at the local school in Pauingassi, Manitoba. At approximately 11:00 pm Betsy left the school with her boyfriend, returning to his residence. Betsy was last seen by her boyfriend the following morning when she left his home. Despite several searches, Miss. Owens has not been found. An extensive investigation was conducted at the time and again in 1996-1997. Betsy's whereabouts remain unknown.
